## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>. Sofia was here!

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
#install.packages('haven')
#install.packages('here')

library(here)
library(haven)

raw_data <- read_dta(here::here("inputs/data/survey.dta"))

dat_male <- dat_use[dat_use$gender == "Male"

raw_data$gender
                    
raw_data <- raw_data[raw_data$gender == "Male"]
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
